verses.verse: Knowest <WH3045> <WH8804> thou the time <WH6256> when the wild goats <WH3277> of the rock <WH5553> bring forth <WH3205> <WH8800>? or canst thou mark <WH8104> <WH8799> when the hinds <WH355> do calve <WH2342> <WH8790> ?
Canst thou number <WH5608> <WH8799> the months <WH3391> that they fulfil <WH4390> <WH8762>? or knowest <WH3045> <WH8804> thou the time <WH6256> when they bring forth <WH3205> <WH8800> ?
They bow <WH3766> <WH8799> themselves, they bring forth <WH6398> <WH8762> their young ones <WH3206>, they cast out <WH7971> <WH8762> their sorrows <WH2256>.
Their young ones <WH1121> are in good liking <WH2492> <WH8799>, they grow up <WH7235> <WH8799> with corn <WH1250>; they go forth <WH3318> <WH8804>, and return <WH7725> <WH8804> not unto them.
Who hath sent out <WH7971> <WH8765> the wild ass <WH6501> free <WH2670>? or who hath loosed <WH6605> <WH8765> the bands <WH4147> of the wild ass <WH6171> ?
Whose house <WH1004> I have made <WH7760> <WH8804> the wilderness <WH6160>, and the barren <WH4420> land his dwellings <WH4908>.
He scorneth <WH7832> <WH8799> the multitude <WH1995> of the city <WH7151>, neither regardeth <WH8085> <WH8799> he the crying <WH8663> of the driver <WH5065> <WH8802>.
The range <WH3491> of the mountains <WH2022> is his pasture <WH4829>, and he searcheth <WH1875> <WH8799> after <WH310> every green thing <WH3387>.
Will the unicorn <WH7214> be willing <WH14> <WH8799> to serve <WH5647> <WH8800> thee, or abide <WH3885> <WH8799> by thy crib <WH18> ?
Canst thou bind <WH7194> <WH8799> the unicorn <WH7214> with his band <WH5688> in the furrow <WH8525>? or will he harrow <WH7702> <WH8762> the valleys <WH6010> after <WH310> thee?
Wilt thou trust <WH982> <WH8799> him, because his strength <WH3581> is great <WH7227>? or wilt thou leave <WH5800> <WH8799> thy labour <WH3018> to him?
Wilt thou believe <WH539> <WH8686> him, that he will bring home <WH7725> <WH8686> <WH8675> <WH7725> <WH8799> thy seed <WH2233>, and gather <WH622> <WH8799> it into thy barn <WH1637> ?
Gavest thou the goodly <WH7443> wings <WH3671> unto the peacocks <WH5965> <WH8738>? or wings <WH84> and feathers <WH2624> unto the ostrich <WH5133> ?
Which leaveth <WH5800> <WH8799> her eggs <WH1000> in the earth <WH776>, and warmeth <WH2552> <WH8762> them in dust <WH6083>,
And forgetteth <WH7911> <WH8799> that the foot <WH7272> may crush <WH2115> <WH8799> them, or that the wild <WH7704> beast <WH2416> may break <WH1758> <WH8799> them.
She is hardened <WH7188> <WH8689> against her young ones <WH1121>, as though they were not <WH3808> hers: her labour <WH3018> is in vain <WH7385> without fear <WH6343>;
Because 'Elohim <WH433> hath deprived <WH5382> <WH8689> her of wisdom <WH2451>, neither hath he imparted <WH2505> <WH8804> to her understanding <WH998>.
What time <WH6256> she lifteth up <WH4754> <WH8686> herself on high <WH4791>, she scorneth <WH7832> <WH8799> the horse <WH5483> and his rider <WH7392> <WH8802>.
Hast thou given <WH5414> <WH8799> the horse <WH5483> strength <WH1369>? hast thou clothed <WH3847> <WH8686> his neck <WH6677> with thunder <WH7483> ?
Canst thou make him afraid <WH7493> <WH8686> as a grasshopper <WH697>? the glory <WH1935> of his nostrils <WH5170> is terrible <WH367>.
He paweth <WH2658> <WH8799> in the valley <WH6010>, and rejoiceth <WH7797> <WH8799> in his strength <WH3581>: he goeth on <WH3318> <WH8799> to meet <WH7125> <WH8800> the armed men <WH5402>.
He mocketh <WH7832> <WH8799> at fear <WH6343>, and is not affrighted <WH2865> <WH8735>; neither turneth he back <WH7725> <WH8799> from <WH6440> the sword <WH2719>.
The quiver <WH827> rattleth <WH7439> <WH8799> against him, the glittering <WH3851> spear <WH2595> and the shield <WH3591>.
He swalloweth <WH1572> <WH8762> the ground <WH776> with fierceness <WH7494> and rage <WH7267>: neither believeth <WH539> <WH8686> he that it is the sound <WH6963> of the shofar <WH7782>.

He saith <WH559> <WH8799> among <WH1767> the shofars <WH7782>, Ha <WH1889>, ha <WH1889>; and he smelleth <WH7306> <WH8686> the battle <WH4421> afar off <WH7350>, the thunder <WH7482> of the captains <WH8269>, and the shouting <WH8643>.
Doth the hawk <WH5322> fly <WH82> <WH8686> by thy wisdom <WH998>, and stretch <WH6566> <WH8799> her wings <WH3671> toward the south <WH8486> ?
Doth the eagle <WH5404> mount up <WH1361> <WH8686> at thy command <WH6310>, and make <WH7311> her nest <WH7064> on high <WH7311> <WH8686> ?
She dwelleth <WH7931> <WH8799> and abideth <WH3885> <WH8698> on the rock <WH5553>, upon the crag <WH8127> of the rock <WH5553>, and the strong place <WH4686>.
From thence she seeketh <WH2658> <WH8804> the prey <WH400>, and her eyes <WH5869> behold <WH5027> <WH8686> afar off <WH7350>.
Her young ones <WH667> also suck up <WH5966> <WH8762> blood <WH1818>: and where the slain <WH2491> are, there is she <WH1931>.
